result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Klein.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Defendant Bradley M Pike in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dismissed and Read-in to: 16CM1267.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Bradley M Pike in court with Attorney Jessica A Klein.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Klein requests a plea and sentence date.  Court sets plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on August 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Bradley M Pike in court with Attorney Jessica A Klein.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Klein requests an adjournment of trial due to having another trial on another case on same date.  State does not object.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Hearing at 01-15-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Bradley M Pike in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court previously set hearing date during Co-Defendant's case. Court sets.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Not to allow his children to be unsupervised by anybody other than adult.

Defendant Bradley M Pike in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Case recalled at 9:53 with same appearances.  Court order the appointment of counsel with the same terms as ordered in his other case.  
  Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 10:30 am.
